answers.answer: These symptoms can occur because of an elevation in your blood pressure or it could rarely be caused by blockage in the carotid artery.  You should have this checked.

question: In the past three months I have been having tightness in my chest (center) and palpitations.  Althouhg I've had these symptoms before, I am now having a strange gushing sound in my ear, not a heart beat, but something like a whoosh sound in my heartbeat rythm.  My internist checked my ears, said they were fine, but attributed my strange sound to stress.  I have hypertension, asthma, RA, fibromyalgia, depresion, anxiety, thalasemia, diabetes II (under control with diet and excercise), recurrent chronic gastritis and chronic venous insufficiency (internal system) in my right leg.  Due to a recent episode of chronic gastritis, I am only taking Avapro 150mg, Nexium 40mg 2x a day, and Reglan 10mg (stomach aches terribly if take other medications).  My doctor perscribed Verapamil 40mg 2x a day.  Why am I having this terribly uncomfortable sound, can it be something I should consult with my cardiologist?
title: Gushing sounds
